intro: Staphidium bracteosum, commonly known as the bracteate staphidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
